identificationModule.briefTitle: Improved Basophil Activation Test (BAT) in the Diagnostics of Drug Allergy
identificationModule.officialTitle: Improved Basophil Activation Test (BAT) in the Diagnostics of IgE-mediated Drug Allergy

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Current study evaluates the use of the improved Basophil Activation Test (BAT) in the diagnostics of IgE-mediated allergy to antibiotics and non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs).
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Current study evaluates the use of the improved Basophil Activation Test (BAT) in the diagnostics of IgE-mediated allergy to antibiotics and non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs). Among commonly used CD63/CD203c markers, newly proposed molecules, such as CD69, CD107a, CD164, CD13, CD11b and CD300a will be assayed. Results obtained together with the other clinical data will be used to calculate sensitivity and specificity of the method.

bioSpec.description: Whole blood drained into tubes with sodium heparin

armGroups.label: Patients with drug allergy
armGroups.description: Patients with drug allergy to antibiotics or NSAIDs
